```{r}
library(dplyr)
```

```{r}
#read the data
file = read.csv("us-counties.csv")
``` 

```{r}
#display the data
tail(file)
file$date <- as.Date(file$date)
```

```{r}
#daily cases
file <- file %>%
  # group by country and states
  group_by(county, state) %>%
  arrange(date, .by_group = TRUE) %>%
  # non-cumulative daily cases
  mutate(daily_cases = cases - lag(cases, 1, default = 0))
```

```{r}
#state daily cases
state_daily <- file %>%
  group_by(date, state) %>%
  summarise(daily_new = sum(daily_cases), .groups = "drop")

#look at california
CA = subset(state_daily, state == "California")
```


```{r}
CA
```
```{r}
plot(CA$date, CA$daily_new, ylim = c(0, 50000))
```
